page.title: 01Warton,Near Carnforth,Lancs.
page.content: Warton lies at the foot of a limestone craggy ridge near Morecambe Bay. The partly wooded crag affords a view of the sea, the Pennines and Lakeland. The principal coastal routes by road, rail and canal to north and south and by rail to east and west cross the tidal Keer Valley which provides dairy farming and gravel extraction. The village retains an old rural charm. Its terraced limestone cottages reflect a long history, largely hiding modern brick housing estates and a 20th century way of life. A mile away the south main road to Carnforth separates small Victorian cottages from modern brick bungalows in the lesser community of Millhead which has a little modern industry.
